title: American_Top_40_1982_April_17th
description:
"Hello again and welcome to American Top Forty. My name's Casey Kasem and I'm all set to countdown the biggest hits in the USA."

American Top 40 with Casey Kasem aired on radio from July 4, 1970 until August 6, 1988. This is a recording of a rebroadcast from internet radio.

In this broadcast:

Stevie Wonder is well represented in this countdown. He has a song at number 10, a duet with Paul McCartney at number 21, and a "Stars On 45" tribute at number 38.

Bob and Doug McKenzie have a song at number 37 with a guest appearance by Canadian RUSH front-man Geddy Lee.

Two listeners ask the same question, "In chart history, what song  has spent the most weeks at number one?" Casey says it's a three way tie between big band songs.  

Casey discusses number one songs based on fads; one about running naked in public, one about the CB radio, and one about the martial arts.

Vangelis won an Oscar for his score to "Chariots Of Fire". Casey tells how he failed the only music school he ever attended.

LW#3: Chariots Of Fire - Vangelis
LW#2: We Got The Beat - Go-Go's
LW#1: I Love Rock 'N Roll - Joan Jett & The Blackhearts
